sen.j: 五街道（ごかいどう）は、江戸時代の江戸を起点とする五つの陸上交通路。
sen.e: Go-kaido Roads were five land traffic routes of the Edo Period starting from Edo.
Go-kaido Roads were five land traffic routes of the Edo period starting from Edo.
Go-kaido Roads were five land traffic routes of the Edo period starting from Edo.

sen.j: 慶長6年（1601年）に徳川家康が全国支配のために江戸と各地を結ぶ以下の5つの街道を整備し始め、四代将軍徳川家綱の代になって基幹街道に定められた。
sen.e: In 1601 Ieyasu TOKUGAWA began to maintain 5 routes (described as follows) connecting Edo to various places to rule all over Japan, and in the time of the 4 Shogun, Ietsuna TOKUGAWA these routes were defined as main routes.

In 1601 Ieyasu TOKUGAWA began to maintain 5 routes (described as follows) connecting Edo to various places to rule all over Japan, and in the time of the 4th Shogun, Ietsuna TOKUGAWA these routes were defined as main routes.

sen.j: 慶長9年（1604年）に日本橋 (東京都中央区)が五街道の起点として定められた。
sen.e: In 1604 Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) was defined as the starting point of Go-kaido Roads.
In 1604 Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo Prefecture) was defined as the starting point of Go-kaido Roads.

sen.j: 整備として一里ごとに一里塚を設けたほか、一定間隔ごとに宿場を用意した。
sen.e: Ichirizuka (a milestone ) were put up between "Ri"s (about 3.927km) as the road maintenance and inns were at regular intervals.

sen.j: 万治2年（1659年）以降は新たに設置された道中奉行の管轄に置かれた。
sen.e: They came under the jurisdiction of newly-created Dochu-bugyo (magistrate of major roads) after 1659.

sen.e: The roads which ran from Edo to Sendai along the Pacific coast were called 'Rikuzenhama-kaido Road,' and among them the one which ran to Mito City, where one of three privileged branches of Tokugawa family was located, was occasionally called 'Mito-kaido Road.'

The Salt Road: The name of the roads which were used for transportation of marine products from the coasts to the mountains.

sen.j: 特に中部地方の塩の道 (日本)が有名。
sen.e: Among them the Salt Road in Chubu region was famous.
